news.title: Walmart hikes sales and earnings outlook even as it says tariff costs are rising
news.summary: Walmart said it has raised prices for some items but kept others unchanged as tariff costs rise. Walmart: Some items have been increased but others have been kept the same.

news.title: Kansas City Fed's Schmid shows hesitation about widely expected September rate cut
news.summary: Market pricing points strongly to the FOMC lowering its key borrowing rate next month. The policymaker pushed back on market pricing that points to the rate being lowered.

news.title: Spirit Airlines is on shakier ground after avoiding hard decisions in bankruptcy
news.summary: Spirit Airlines raised doubts last week that it could survive a year without more cash. Spirit Airlines raised questions last week about its ability to survive without more money.

news.title: U.S. and EU spell out tariffs for autos, pharmaceuticals, and more
news.summary: The U.S. and European Union had first struck a trade agreement in July, but many details were left unresolved at the time. The agreement is expected to be implemented by the end of the year.

news.title: How billionaire family offices bet on stocks during tariff turmoil
news.summary: Private investment firms of Leon Cooperman and other finance billionaires disclosed surprising stock moves. Private investment firms  disclosed surprising stocks moves of finance billionaires. The moves were made in response to a series of events in the financial world.

news.title: Why Social Security beats anything insurance companies offer
news.summary: The same inflation-adjusted annuity benefits would be prohibitively expensive to obtain in the private market. The benefits would also be more expensive to get in the public market.

news.title: Walmart says tariffs are raising costs, but it’s trying to avoid price increases — for now
news.summary: “We’re keeping our prices as low as we can,” Walmart CEO Doug McMillon said in regard to the impact of tariffs.

news.title: ‘The money went into his account’: Is my father trying to swindle me out of my grandparents’ $800K home?
news.summary: “I came across a letter from my father’s bank showing a wire transfer of $195,000 from the buyer,” she says.

news.title: There’s a slow-motion crisis in bonds — and this bearish strategist thinks it will hit stocks
news.summary: Societe Generale’s Albert Edwards says the move higher in long government bond yields has been “relentless,” and investors have ignored it.

news.title: Jobless claims jump to 2-month high — but still no sign of rising U.S. layoffs
news.summary: Businesses aren’t hiring or firing many workers, according to a new study. The study found that most businesses don't want to hire or fire many workers.
